column4: why doesn't apache not show up in my ubuntu software updater? 9.10
dunno how do i find out? i thought it would show up in the ubuntu software update if it was installed or not installed
it does not show up in my list . (thought all compatible software showed up in the ubuntu software updater)
i want to set up apache and mysql to run joomla locally
What are you wanting to build? or serve?
is that the command i need to run to get them all ?
how do i terminate the command  apt-cache search apache
If your end goal is to build a joomla page in order to upload to a production server, joomla jumpbox is for you.  (Will be easier)
I've only done it manually.  Just install a psp enabled apache server and mysql and your good to go.
CMS is the wave of the future /imo
